verses.kjv: And it came to pass after this, that Absalom prepared him chariots and horses, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.web: After this, Absalom prepared a chariot and horses for himself, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.ct: Some time later, Absalom got himself a chariot, horses, and 50 men to run ahead of him wherever he went.

verses.kjv: And Absalom rose up early, and stood beside the way of the gate: and it was so, that when any man that had a controversy came to the king for judgment, then Absalom called unto him, and said, Of what city art thou? And he said, Thy servant is of one of the tribes of Israel.
verses.web: Absalom rose up early, and stood beside the way of the gate. When any man had a suit which should come to the king for judgment, then Absalom called to him, and said, “What city are you from?” He said, “Your servant is of one of the tribes of Israel.”
verses.ct: Absalom would get up early and stand beside the road leading to the city gate. Whenever someone was on their way to bring a dispute before the king for a ruling, Absalom would call out to them and ask, "What city are you from?" The person would answer, "Your servant is from one of the tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: And Absalom said unto him, See, thy matters are good and right; but there is no man deputed of the king to hear thee.
verses.web: Absalom said to him, “Behold, your matters are good and right; but there is no man deputized by the king to hear you.”
verses.ct: Absalom would tell them, "Look, your case is clearly valid and fair — but the king hasn't appointed anyone to hear it."

verses.kjv: Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man which hath any suit or cause might come unto me, and I would do him justice!
verses.web: Absalom said moreover, “Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man who has any suit or cause might come to me, and I would do him justice!”
verses.ct: Then Absalom would add, "If only someone would make me judge over this land! Then anyone with a complaint or dispute could come to me, and I'd make sure they got justice."

verses.kjv: And it was so, that when any man came nigh to him to do him obeisance, he put forth his hand, and took him, and kissed him.
verses.web: It was so, that when any man came near to bow down to him, he stretched out his hand, and took hold of him, and kissed him.
verses.ct: Whenever someone approached and began to bow before him, Absalom would reach out, take hold of them, and kiss them.

verses.kjv: And on this manner did Absalom to all Israel that came to the king for judgment: so Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.
verses.web: Absalom did this sort of thing to all Israel who came to the king for judgment. So Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.
verses.ct: Absalom did this with everyone from Israel who came to the king for a ruling. Little by little, he stole the hearts of the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after forty years, that Absalom said unto the king, I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto the LORD, in Hebron.
verses.web: At the end of forty years, Absalom said to the king, “Please let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed to LORD, in Hebron.
verses.ct: After 40 years, Absalom said to the king, "Please let me go to Hebron to fulfill a vow I made to the LORD."

verses.kjv: For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Syria, saying, If the LORD shall bring me again indeed to Jerusalem, then I will serve the LORD.
verses.web: For your servant vowed a vow while I stayed at Geshur in Syria, saying, ‘If LORD shall indeed bring me again to Jerusalem, then I will serve LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: "While I was living in Geshur in Syria, your servant made a vow: 'If the LORD brings me back to Jerusalem, I will serve the LORD.'"

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to Hebron.
verses.web: The king said to him, “Go in peace.” So he arose, and went to Hebron.
verses.ct: The king told him, "Go in peace." So Absalom left for Hebron.

verses.kjv: But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, As soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet, then ye shall say, Absalom reigneth in Hebron.
verses.web: But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, “As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpet, then you shall say, ‘Absalom is king in Hebron!’ ”
verses.ct: But Absalom had secretly sent agents throughout all the tribes of Israel with instructions: "The moment you hear the trumpet blast, announce that Absalom has become king in Hebron!"

verses.kjv: And with Absalom went two hundred men out of Jerusalem, that were called; and they went in their simplicity, and they knew not any thing.
verses.web: Two hundred men went with Absalom out of Jerusalem, who were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they didn’t know anything.
verses.ct: 200 men from Jerusalem went with Absalom. They had been invited as guests and went innocently, knowing nothing about his plans.

verses.kjv: And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David’s counsellor, from his city, even from Giloh, while he offered sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.
verses.web: Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David’s counselor, from his city, even from Giloh, while he was offering the sacrifices. The conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.
verses.ct: While offering sacrifices, Absalom also sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite — David's own advisor — summoning him from his hometown of Giloh. The conspiracy gained momentum as more and more people rallied to Absalom's side.

verses.kjv: And there came a messenger to David, saying, The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom.
verses.web: A messenger came to David, saying, “The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom.”
verses.ct: A messenger came to David with the news: "The hearts of the people of Israel have turned to Absalom."

verses.kjv: And David said unto all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem, Arise, and let us flee; for we shall not else escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he overtake us suddenly, and bring evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.
verses.web: David said to all his servants who were with him at Jerusalem, “Arise! Let’s flee; or else none of us will escape from Absalom. Hurry to depart, lest he overtake us quickly, and bring down evil on us, and strike the city with the edge of the sword.”
verses.ct: David immediately told all his officials who were with him in Jerusalem, "Get up — we have to run! If we don't move fast, none of us will escape Absalom. Hurry, before he catches up to us, brings disaster down on us, and puts the whole city to the sword."

verses.kjv: And the king’s servants said unto the king, Behold, thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my lord the king shall appoint.
verses.web: The king’s servants said to the king, “Behold, your servants are ready to do whatever my lord the king chooses.”
verses.ct: The king's servants replied, "Whatever our lord the king decides, we're ready to do it."

verses.kjv: And the king went forth, and all his household after him. And the king left ten women, which were concubines, to keep the house.
verses.web: The king went out, and all his household after him. The king left ten women, who were concubines, to keep the house.
verses.ct: So the king set out on foot with his entire household following him. He left behind 10 concubines to take care of the palace.

verses.kjv: And the king went forth, and all the people after him, and tarried in a place that was far off.
verses.web: The king went out, and all the people after him; and they stayed in Beth Merhak.
verses.ct: The king left with all the people following him, and they stopped at a place on the outskirts of the city.

verses.kjv: And all his servants passed on beside him; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men which came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.
verses.web: All his servants passed on beside him; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men who came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.
verses.ct: All his servants marched past him, along with all the Cherethites, all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites — 600 men who had followed him from Gath — and they took the lead ahead of the king.

verses.kjv: Then said the king to Ittai the Gittite, Wherefore goest thou also with us? return to thy place, and abide with the king: for thou art a stranger, and also an exile.
verses.web: Then the king said to Ittai the Gittite, “Why do you also go with us? Return, and stay with the king; for you are a foreigner, and also an exile. Return to your own place.
verses.ct: The king said to Ittai the Gittite, "Why are you coming with us? Go back and stay with the new king. You're a foreigner and an exile from your own homeland."

verses.kjv: Whereas thou camest but yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us? seeing I go whither I may, return thou, and take back thy brethren: mercy and truth be with thee.
verses.web: Whereas you came but yesterday, should I today make you go up and down with us, since I go where I may? Return, and take back your brothers. Mercy and truth be with you.”
verses.ct: "You only arrived yesterday — should I drag you around with us today when I don't even know where I'm going? Go back and take your men with you. May mercy and faithfulness be with you."

verses.kjv: And Ittai answered the king, and said, As the LORD liveth, and as my lord the king liveth, surely in what place my lord the king shall be, whether in death or life, even there also will thy servant be.
verses.web: Ittai answered the king, and said, “As LORD lives, and as my lord the king lives, surely in what place my lord the king is, whether for death or for life, your servant will be there also.”
verses.ct: But Ittai answered the king, "As the LORD lives, and as my lord the king lives, wherever my lord the king is — whether it means life or death — that's where your servant will be."

verses.kjv: And David said to Ittai, Go and pass over. And Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all his men, and all the little ones that were with him.
verses.web: David said to Ittai, “Go and pass over.” Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all his men, and all the little ones who were with him.
verses.ct: David said to Ittai, "Then come — march on." So Ittai the Gittite crossed over with all his men and all the families who were with him.

verses.kjv: And all the country wept with a loud voice, and all the people passed over: the king also himself passed over the brook Kidron, and all the people passed over, toward the way of the wilderness.
verses.web: All the country wept with a loud voice, and all the people passed over. The king also himself passed over the brook Kidron, and all the people passed over, toward the way of the wilderness.
verses.ct: The whole countryside wept loudly as all the people crossed over. The king himself crossed the Kidron Brook, and everyone headed toward the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And lo Zadok also, and all the Levites were with him, bearing the ark of the covenant of God: and they set down the ark of God; and Abiathar went up, until all the people had done passing out of the city.
verses.web: Behold, Zadok also came, and all the Levites with him, bearing the ark of the covenant of God; and they set down God’s ark; and Abiathar went up, until all the people finished passing out of the city.
verses.ct: Zadok was there too, along with all the Levites, carrying the ark of the covenant of God. They set the ark of God down, and Abiathar offered sacrifices until everyone had finished leaving the city.

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Zadok, Carry back the ark of God into the city: if I shall find favour in the eyes of the LORD, he will bring me again, and shew me both it, and his habitation:
verses.web: The king said to Zadok, “Carry God’s ark back into the city. If I find favor in LORD’s eyes, he will bring me again, and show me both it, and his habitation;
verses.ct: Then the king said to Zadok, "Take the ark of God back into the city. If the LORD is pleased with me, he'll bring me back and let me see it and his dwelling place again."

verses.kjv: But if he thus say, I have no delight in thee; behold, here am I, let him do to me as seemeth good unto him.
verses.web: but if he says, ‘I have no delight in you;’ behold, here I am. Let him do to me as seems good to him.”
verses.ct: "But if he says, 'I take no pleasure in you' — then here I am. Let him do to me whatever he thinks is right."

verses.kjv: The king said also unto Zadok the priest, Art not thou a seer? return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you, Ahimaaz thy son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.
verses.web: The king said also to Zadok the priest, “Aren’t you a seer? Return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you, Ahimaaz your son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.
verses.ct: The king also said to Zadok the priest, "You're a seer, aren't you? Go back to the city in peace, and take your 2 sons with you — your son Ahimaaz and Abiathar's son Jonathan."

verses.kjv: See, I will tarry in the plain of the wilderness, until there come word from you to certify me.
verses.web: Behold, I will stay at the fords of the wilderness, until word comes from you to inform me.”
verses.ct: "I'll wait at the river crossings in the wilderness until I hear from you with news."

verses.kjv: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem: and they tarried there.
verses.web: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried God’s ark to Jerusalem again; and they stayed there.
verses.ct: So Zadok and Abiathar carried the ark of God back to Jerusalem and stayed there.

verses.kjv: And David went up by the ascent of mount Olivet, and wept as he went up, and had his head covered, and he went barefoot: and all the people that was with him covered every man his head, and they went up, weeping as they went up.
verses.web: David went up by the ascent of the Mount of Olives, and wept as he went up; and he had his head covered, and went barefoot. All the people who were with him each covered his head, and they went up, weeping as they went up.
verses.ct: David climbed the Mount of Olives, weeping as he went. His head was covered and his feet were bare. Everyone with him also covered their heads and wept as they climbed.

verses.kjv: And one told David, saying, Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom. And David said, O LORD, I pray thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.
verses.web: Someone told David, saying, “Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom.” David said, “LORD, please turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.”
verses.ct: Then someone told David, "Ahithophel has joined the conspirators with Absalom." David prayed, "LORD, please turn Ahithophel's advice into foolishness."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when David was come to the top of the mount, where he worshipped God, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent, and earth upon his head:
verses.web: When David had come to the top, where God was worshiped, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his tunic torn, and earth on his head.
verses.ct: When David reached the summit where people worshiped God, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his tunic torn and dirt on his head.

verses.kjv: Unto whom David said, If thou passest on with me, then thou shalt be a burden unto me:
verses.web: David said to him, “If you pass on with me, then you will be a burden to me;
verses.ct: David told him, "If you come with me, you'll only be a burden."

verses.kjv: But if thou return to the city, and say unto Absalom, I will be thy servant, O king; as I have been thy father’s servant hitherto, so will I now also be thy servant: then mayest thou for me defeat the counsel of Ahithophel.
verses.web: but if you return to the city, and tell Absalom, ‘I will be your servant, O king. As I have been your father’s servant in time past, so I will now be your servant; then will you defeat for me the counsel of Ahithophel.’
verses.ct: "But if you go back to the city and tell Absalom, 'I'll be your servant, O king — just as I served your father before, I'll now serve you' — then you can undermine Ahithophel's advice for me."

verses.kjv: And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, that what thing soever thou shalt hear out of the king’s house, thou shalt tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.
verses.web: Don’t you have Zadok and Abiathar the priests there with you? Therefore whatever you hear out of the king’s house, tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.
verses.ct: "Zadok and Abiathar the priests will be there with you. Whatever you hear in the king's palace, report it to Zadok and Abiathar."

verses.kjv: Behold, they have there with them their two sons, Ahimaaz Zadok’s son, and Jonathan Abiathar’s son; and by them ye shall send unto me every thing that ye can hear.
verses.web: Behold, they have there with them their two sons, Ahimaaz, Zadok’s son, and Jonathan, Abiathar’s son. Send to me everything that you shall hear by them.”
verses.ct: "Their 2 sons are with them — Zadok's son Ahimaaz and Abiathar's son Jonathan. Send everything you learn to me through them."

verses.kjv: So Hushai David’s friend came into the city, and Absalom came into Jerusalem.
verses.web: So Hushai, David’s friend, came into the city; and Absalom came into Jerusalem.
verses.ct: So Hushai, David's friend, headed back into the city just as Absalom was arriving in Jerusalem.
